00112 /******************************************************************************/
00120 typedef unsigned int CBUFFNUM;
00126 /******************************************************************************* 
00127 * Structure: CBUFFTYPE                                                   
00128 * This structure holds the following information that is needed to understand
00129 * the status of the buffer.
00130 * - startOfBuffer       - Pointer to the start of the memory the user has given
00131 *                         the CBUFF module
00132 * - endOfBuffer         - Pointer to the end of the memory the user has given 
00133 *                         the CBUFF module
00134 * - inPointer           - Pointer to the write-in point into the buffer, the
00135 *                         point in the buffer where the next piece of data will
00136 *                         be written
00137 * - outPointer          - Pointer to the read-out point into the buffer, the
00138 *                         point in the buffer where the next piece of data will
00139 *                         be read out of
00140 * - bufferNumer         - The unique reference number assigned to this buffer by
00141 *                         the CBUFF module open its creation
00142 * - localFlag           - Handles status flags for this buffer. The flags are 
00143 *                         defined as CBUFF_FULL, CBUFF_EMPTY and CBUFF_OPEN in 
00144 *                         cbuff.c
00145 * - nextCircBufferObj   - Pointer to the next CBUFF object in the linked list,
00146 *                         if there is an next object, else NULL.
00147 *******************************************************************************/
00148 struct CBUFFTYPE {
00149     CBUFF               * startOfBuffer;
00150     CBUFF               * endOfBuffer;
00151     CBUFF               * inPointer;
00152     CBUFF               * outPointer;
00153     CBUFFNUM              bufferNumber;
00154     unsigned char         localFlag;
00155     struct CBUFFTYPE    * nextCircBufferObj;
00156 };
00157 /* \endcond                                                                   */
00158 
00159 /******************************************************************************/
00163 /******************************************************************************/
00171 typedef struct CBUFFTYPE CBUFFOBJ;
00172 
00173 /******************************************************************************/
00179 typedef CBUFFOBJ * HCBUFF;
